Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: matman830
Reviews.Content: The place needs renovation, the wi-fi works better in the inner atrium areas than in the rooms, but for the price it's great. The staff are helpful, professional and kind. Rooms are clean, and things mostly work. The hotel is in the center of a large city, so there is some street noise, but the building was converted into a hotel 70 years ago, and remains unchanged. Street noise was a part of life then. The Majestic has a terrace restaurant with a great view of the Zocalo. The food is OK and fairly priced, but the view is great. For the price, it's worth it, and a nice piece of history.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old building, loud and expensive”
Reviews.Author: abtraveler_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a much reduced rate, but I must say I couldn't recommend this at it's normal going rate. The building is 400-some years old and while beautiful, you can hear EVERY noise if you have neighbors on either side of you. But they did have REAL and very nice large bathtubs in the rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money - would never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: bosquef
Reviews.Content: I had a very negative experience during my recent stay here, and would not stay again. First, when we called ahead to find out if parking was available, we spoke to a woman answering the phone who told us that parking was available at a low price. When we arrived, however, they told us that no parking was available, (and we thus had to spend almost half of the hotel rate on parking in a nearby site). They also denied that any women worked at the front desk or answered the phone, although the following morning there in fact was a woman answering the phone. In addition, they were very rude to us. In spite of the fact that we were obviously a couple, they gave us a room with two single beds, and although we immediately asked to change, and had been in the room only one minute, they sent someone to inspect the room before we could get another room. The room we ended up with was in poor condition, the bed was just two single beds pushed together, and the curtains were damaged so the light came into the room and we slept very poorly. The location of this hotel is excellent, there is some beautiful features in the lobby and stairs, and we enjoyed breakfast at the rooftop restaurant, but with the extra money we spent on parking we could have stayed at any of the many other hotels in the same neighborhood for a higher price, and even hotels that cost half as much have rooms in better condition. Worth coming in to see the old tilework and the rooftop restaurant, but if you want to be treated with hospitality or sleep in a comfortable room, this isn't the place.

Reviews.Title: “Faded grandeur in great location”
Reviews.Author: Rick049
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Hotel Majestic twice, once in October 2009, and again in February 2011. If I had reviewed it in 2009, I would have given it four stars. Based on our more recent stay, I would only give it an "average" three star rating. This is unquestionably a once great hotel fallen on more difficult times. The entire facility feels faded, old, and out of date. The rooms are comfortable enough, but hardly top notch. The beds are some of the firmest (read: hardest) I've ever slept on in my life. However, I find that good for my back, so I don't mind. The bathrooms are old, and in need of modernization. Nevertheless, there is something about this hotel I love, and it's not just the incredibly good location on pedestrian-friendly Calle Madero, right on the Zocolo in the center of Mexico D.F. The staff has always been very friendly and helpful to me. The facility, while aged, retains much of its original beauty. Plus, the price is right: this is a very economical place to stay. I would stay there again, should I return to Mexico City. Just don't expect luxury or ultra modern facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Aging beauty; great rooftop view”
Reviews.Author: cdub333
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned here 24 years ago and were eager to see how the old Majestic was holding up. The lobby and grand staircase are still eye-popping. The human-operated, brass elevator takes you to a bygone era, for sure. The place is old and needs an overhaul. Our room had an insanely noisy neighbor, so the front desk moved us to a more secluded room which was tiny but had huge closets. No natural light or air (we followed the lead of previous TripAdvisor reviews and asked for a fan but there were none). Nice bed, problem-free plumbing; aging electric outlets wouldn't hold our chargers. The rooftop restaurant offers a great view of the zocalo. Breakfast buffet is pricey (try the jugo verde, a refreshing juice made of cactus & celery), but the coffee keeps coming and the scenery is fantastic. As the cathedral bells rang, we saw zocalo action (two different protest marches, Sunday morning church-goers) and the snow-capped volcano. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. Yeah, the Majestic is showing its age, but is a good bargain for its central location and old-style feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great situation but very noisy night!”
Reviews.Author: cathbaker14
Reviews.Content: I was attracted to this hotel because of its situaiton next to the Zocalo, the main square, in Mexico City and I was really happy to be given a room overlooking the square, with a clear view of the two volcanoes Popocatepetl and Iztaccihuatl in the distance. The hotel is showing its age in its fittings and furniture but it has a certain charm and I was glad to have chosen it for an overnight stay (the airport is only a 10-15 minute taxi ride away). I had always wanted to visit its rooftop restaurant where I had breakfast the next morning. The negative aspect was what happened inbetween- ear-splitting noises above my head from what sounded like a giant stone washing machine and then very, very loud bangs as if from a metal rod. Very frightening and disturbing, even for me (extremely hard-of-hearing). I didn't call to see what it was as I kept thinking it would stop. After about 2 hours, I managed to fall asleep so I suppose it did stop eventually. Hopefully I will get an explanation as I mentioned it in my check-out survey, and the problem will be solved for future visitors. I'll keep you posted. BTW, excellent price for this city-centre hotel - just over Â£65 including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Location is not enough”
Reviews.Author: charles6346
Reviews.Content: The location off the Zocalo is excellent. The hotel was built in 1937 and looks like it needs a complete renovation. The room was clean. The bed was hard. I had to call twice to have the toilet fixed. The balacony doors were hard to close. The biggest problem is the noise. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Creeping_Death_LA
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at 530am into MEX airport. The taxi dropped us off at the hotel and it was locked or looked closed. At first I was shocked and thought they must of went out of business. The taxi driver told me they close the doors overnight due to security. I am glad I stayed at this hotel it was in a perfect location. We were given a room that overlooks the Zocalo, it was Mexican Independence week so all the buildings were decorated with lights. The hotel is old but still satisfies with its helpful staff. The price is beyond reasonable, I would stay here again if or when I return to DF.

Reviews.Title: “Nice building, good location”
Reviews.Author: Rombach00
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in 2 rooms and enjoyed the lovely building and the good location. Nevertheless, the rooms were very dark, shabby and loud. The connection door between the rooms couldn't e opened. The roof top terrace is beautiful with a fantastic view of the Zocalo, but the breakfast buffet leaves definitvely room for improvement. Good for a night or two, but 5 nights was too long. The internet connection is lousy and didn't work most of the time. The hotel computer is hopeless.

Reviews.Title: “A great location, clean room, but aging is showing.”
Reviews.Author: Linda55555
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the location and chose our room to face the Plaza. It was a little noisy, but we loved opening the window and hearing the church bells and the hustle and bustle of Mexico City. It is on the walking street and easy to get around from there. The rooms are large, comfortable and clean. However, it is easy to see that they are not improving their rooms. We had lamps without bulbs and much of the room looked a little shabby. Wi-fi almost impossible to use and the "business" center computers are close to unusable. The restaurant, which has a great location, was had very average or below food. Wouldn't recommend it. Hallways echo and are noisy. Nevertheless, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not Fabulous but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cedric_The_Cat
Reviews.Content: Arrived on apparently the hottest day in Mexico City for 5 years (after 32 hrs of travelling from Australia). No airconditioning is ok, but being told that there were no electric fans available because it was a Saturday night and it was hot is not ok! First room very noisy due to overlooking the pedestrian mall, but cooler than an internal room overlooking the internal courtyard ( don't forget your earplugs). However, on the 2nd night chose the internal room as fans had become available. Make sure you wear socks in your room as our feet became black after walking on the carpet - internal rooms are dark and stuffy. Should have taken a room overlooking the Zocalo - they are noisy, but you can open the windows and earplugs work a treat. Lots of cafes and restuarants close by. Money changers and an ATM across from the hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooftop restuarant and bar are definite pluses. Great view of the Zocalo, Cathedral, Palace, Govt Offices and all the demonstrators and their tents! Atmospheric. Not a fabulous hotel but its location is great and the hotel and its staff are full of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Best location. For the noise, ask for an electric fan!”
Reviews.Author: Emeo
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in D.F. and my second time staying in this hotel. My last time staying here was in 1994 when it was almost brand-new. It was a complete deja vu, everything in the hotel was exactly how I remembered. The good thing is the deco which had a lot of mexican flavors, but for the same reasons, things were dated and in needs of renovation. The location is superb - right on Zocalo! There are a couple of 24hr convenience stores nearby and many restaurants options as well. Several Metro lines are right around the corner. Enjoying full breakfast at roof terrace was the best - bright orange sunny-side eggs accompanied by the majestic view of the Zocalo! For the room, I realized there was no air-conditioner. But the electric fan was suffice and it helped buffer the street noise (I am a light sleeper as well). I slept quite well for the 2 nights we were there. Compared back to 1994, nowadays there are no more street venders around the Zocalo - which is a complete disappointment. For me the street vendors and Aztec dancers add a lot more charms to this ever-energetic and fascinating plaza. It's used to be amazing to walk through Templo Mayor's outdoor pyramids with aztec dancer's rhythm fading in the background. Now it's just a bit less exciting to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, could do with a overhaul, but great value!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingLama
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dimly lit, the rooms are clean-ish, but with the Zocalo right outside the window and a nice pedestrian mall outside the hotel, who's complaining. Add the $60 price for a family of four with breakfast and I'm more than satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “the view is spectacular, the roof top restaurant is worth the meal.”
Reviews.Author: yoliee48
Reviews.Content: this will be my third time at this hotel. there is a reason why i return, all the comforts of home.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: mWrite
Reviews.Content: Keep it short: Within this price range unbeatable location and Location. Hotel itself has been built 1937 or something. That creates facilities like bathroom basin has separate taps for cold and hot water. Also very big safety issue is that there is only one(1) exit out of the floors. So in case fire in staircase/elevator lobby (same), then you are stuck to room, but it is pure stone, so less danger. Room is nice, but all rooms facing Zocalo aka Plaza de la ConstituciÃ³n (Constitution Square) are adjacent rooms. Also door safety chains were broken or missing. Apart from "historical" issues (separate taps etc) baseboards were not all well placed and some interesting wiring... Generally rooms are very clean, except the carpeting has not been cleaned (ever?). Amenities/services: Room service is available, but no price list available. I had to look for Guest Directory book. Laundry service is cheap, not necessary hotel issue. TV remote controller was not in the room. You could get it from Reception? Safety box key also must be signed from reception, which I can understand. 2x 500ml water bottles where included in price daily. Nice service! Free WiFi is nice, seldom in MX? Staff: All contacts with staff where good. Nice service. Some staff spoke less English, but we got along. Only misconflict was missing water bottles on 3rd day, not delivered Location: This can of course cause conflicts. If your room is facing Plaza de la ConstituciÃ³n (Constitution Square), then you can experience noice from street (I did not mind), events ( did mind), church bell (did mind sometimes). Pros are though that you can watch nicely Flag raise in the morning with marching band. And lowering the flag takes place at 18hrs. Hotel rates itself as four star, but I might put it three star category. As a three star it would be excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, beautiful hotel, great food, great value”
Reviews.Author: byomkesh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Best Western Majestic this past week and couldn't have been happier. First of all, we had a room on the 6th floor with a balcony and a view of the zocalo that simply cannot be beat. There is just no other place (other than the National Palace Presidential Balcony), that has a better view. Period. Contrary to some of the other reviews on this site, I found the staff there extremely professional and helpful. Reserving/Checking in/out was a breeze, getting a taxi at 3am was simple, and the staff was efficient and helpful. We also used our credit card and unlike the experiences of some others on this site, our credit card wasn't abused or any hidden charges added. The room and interior decor was nice. This is a hotel from the 1930s and some things are old school (e.g. the sink had separate hot water and cold water taps), but it really doesn't take away from the charm. The included breakfast was a full hot breakfast with more food than you can possibly eat. The included internet was reasonably fast, though prone to occasional connection drops. One warning, though. If you are looking for a quiet place to sleep in, then this (or any other hotel around the Zocalo), is not for you. The Zocalo is a lively place prone to everything from beating Aztec drums, to cars to thousands of people. The atmosphere makes it special, but it also makes it noisy. Best of all, the rate of US$86/night including internet and breakfast was a great deal. I highly recommend this hotel, especially at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant, excellent service but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: stevenboise
Reviews.Content: The service here was very good. The restaurant on the roof was very good with great views overlooking the square. It has a good location as well with lots of shops and restaurants within short walking distances of the front door. What you need to be prepared for is the hotel's shortcomings. Now, I know it was built in 1937 so you can chalk these up to that if you'd like. Don't plan on much hot water in the shower. We never had to turn on the cold water to tame it. It was warm, but never hot. Obviously, the water is not potable, as the signs all around the bathroom will remind you. They do provide two .5L bottles of water each morning, which was nice. The walls are very thin. The room we had a connecting room (with a lock on the door), but the door and walls are so thin that the party's conversation next door was clearly audible. I mean clearly. You could understand every word that was spoken. The bed also left a little to be desired. The bed was warm, but the sheets didn't have much extra width or length so if you rolled over too much, you stole everything from your partner. It does have free, unsecured wifi throughout as well. Overall, the hotel was good. By Best Western Standards in the US I would say it underachieved and if all Best Westerns were like this one, I would never stay in another one (especially for $125 a night). But, it was Mexico not the USA and the standards just are not the same. That's not meant to be insulting, just realistic. This hotel did not meet my expectations for the cost if it had been in the USA. But it wasn't. So, with that in mind it was alright and I would recommend this hotel to a friend with the warnings about the thin walls, bed and water.

Reviews.Title: “lovely old hotel with character and well mannered staff”
Reviews.Author: calgarytraveller02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and friends have stayed at this hotel 2 times and each time it was as good as the first.The staff are very polite and helpful and a added feature they wear lovely red uniforms!The hotel has all the curtsies of a times gone by. You cannot get a better location than this.Right on the main square with the beautiful old church and government buildings . The first time there was a first class art show on the square that was free to the public!The second time there was a famous Mexican singer who played for 2 hours and 60,000 people attended and there was no confusion or upset as the people were controlled by their competent police force that kept the people flowing and in good spirits!There is always something happening in this square so you are welcome to participate and if you tire your hotel is right there!So you cannot beat this location...and there are fabulous restaurants right outside the door which the staff can recommend or if you want you can stay and dine in.We never had dinner but had a great brunch! I would highly recommend this hotel to people who love old charm and are not looking for a sterile,modern hotel!

Reviews.Title: “CLONING OF CARD !!!! BE FORWARNED”
Reviews.Author: nordictraveller2010
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in the past in the Majestic, we are from Scandinavia. We visited again on August 17 at lunch time. The service and food was so-so, but we go there for the view of the Zocalo. We love Mexico, and my brother and I have come several times. We decided to pay with our foreign credit card, and they took. They told us after 30 minutes, that as it was a foreign credit card, it did not go through - it was stange, as this had not happened in our prior visits, and we paid cash. Coming back home, we found charges amounting to 10,000 Pesos. We are looking into this, but people that know, tell us that cloning is an industry in Mexico, and this was done by the restaurant staff. They decided NOT to pass the charge in the hotel so they cannot be traced back to them - but we KNOW it was them as if was our first day in Mexico, and we did not use this card anymore. We tried to contact the hotel buy the Staff (Rosa Ortega) was not helping us contact the GM, and did not want to help us with this. We love Mexico, but this hotel has a crime ring at the restaurant that goes after unsuspecting foreign tourists - we are seniors (60+yrs), and they took advantage of us and our long trip back home. Very sad and dissapointing that a landmark hotel has this going on, and its management doesn't care. We are sorry that this goes on in Mexico and the Majestic.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: andalusia78
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in this hotel seven years ago and loved it due to it's location overlooking the zocolo, however, our last visit was a more than bad experience - it was a disaster. It was dark and hot - no a/c and rundown. The staff was unfriendly to the point of being rude. Located on the zocolo it is horribly loud with activities on the zocolo 'til the wee hours of the morning so plan on not getting any sleep plus I felt a bug crawling on my face during the night. You have to open the windows to get fresh air and the drums will drive you mad. As to the restaurant - rude, arrogant waiters who really seem to hate their job and you were not allowed to sit in the rooftop restaurant unless you ordered something - even if you were a guest in the hotel. Best Western should rethink their alliance with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever...!!! Avoid”
Reviews.Author: maquinagt
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stay at Majestic at Mexico City, overall Iâ€™m very unhappy about it, for a lot of reasons: 1. It doesnâ€™t have parking facilities, so I have to spend like $25 per night for a like 8 blocks away parking lot (nearer parking lot where much more expensive), and thereâ€™s no warning or advisor about it 2. The bedroom carpet itâ€™s really dirty, I walked with white socks and it turns dark just by walking over the carpet. 3. The bed cover is old 4. Thereâ€™s this bad smell coming from the bathroomâ€™s pipes. 5. There are no commodities like iron, shower cap, shoe polisher and so on 6. Overall the hotel is dirty specially the floor and the livingroom lavatories are broken Overall Iâ€™ll never stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location BUT needs major updating”
Reviews.Author: JudyandDave
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Mexico City - on the Zocalo - this place has location. Built in 1937 it has been given few updates since. Beds were particularly uncomfortable. But the top floor restaurant and bar are very nice and the food good. Old fashioned place but a good deal for the price. Service was good and people very pleasant. The Zocalo can be very noisy and lively on weekends with LOTS going on.

Reviews.Title: “worst service in mexico”
Reviews.Author: mb1945
Reviews.Content: we chose it for the location and the view from the restaurant The restaurant supposedly had buffet from 700am but the day we needed early breakfast it wasnt ready and food was cold the restaurant staff were indifferent @ best We have stayed in other visits at different hotels in the Centro which offered much better service with efficient and hospitable staff the evening meal was horrible poorly cooked frozen vegetables ( when there is a market close by with Mexico's great fresh produce

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LatinGemini
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel, right on the main square. Rooms were a little dated but clean and tidy. Staff at the Hotel were very helpful. The restaurant is on the top floor and has a fantastic view over the main square and of the Volcano's to the back of the city. it is worth going up there for a Photo even if your not stakying there.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy carpets, no hot water, avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Chuckles33Sydney
Reviews.Content: Filthy carpets, brlken light fixtures, old hard beds, and no hot water! Not much changed from Independence in 1810, then.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm Hotel Centrally Located at Very Noisy Zocalo”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite charming with Mexican tiles and typical Mexical details, the location is fantastic overlooking the Zocalo, Mexico City's central square. However, this very central location is part of the problem, as the Zocalo is extremely NOISY, and this comes from an urban dweller accustomed to noise, but at the hotel I learned that I did not know what the definition of the word "noise" was. I had requested a Zocalo-facing room, which opened a great vista, but was unbelievably noisy. The hotel servicewas great and responsive. They were also very helpful in getting a special taxi with a great driver for tours. I think this was an "informal" taxi that was moonlihting, but the quality of service was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: 2Wolfgang
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in 4 star modern hotels in Mexico City and Queretaro, and, for me, I like the old classics better. They are not "polished" and they have a lot of charm. This is my first time staying at the Majestic although I stopped by for a drink there about six months ago. The second floor interior public space is amazing. Both rooms that we had looked out on the church. Yeah, it's noisy if you normally sleep in a quiet neighborhood. For me it was fine. Make sure you eat on the top floor at least once. Very nice. We received a coupon for a free breakfast while we were there. They have a private unmarked bilingual taxi service that was very good. Emelio was the driver and he was at least 80 if he was a day and he was a great tour guide during the drives. We took it for the day up to Friida's museum and then over to the Zona Rosa for 500 pesos. I guess the Federal Police were assigned there because it was a national landmark. There were always three guys assigned to the second floor where we stayed and one guy in the lobby. We walked along the two adjoining streets night and day up to the park and back without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building but not so good service or the room”
Reviews.Author: csrow
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the room was reasonably clean for Mexico. However, I had few problems during my stay. The hotel could be really good if only it could have been managed better. 1) Noise. - There is always something going on outside. Drums, band, or some sort of meeting at the square. The church in the square rings their bells every 15 min. Be sure to take some ear plugs. 2) No A/C - The room wasn't too hot but I can imagine it could get really hot during the summer months. There is a window you can open to get some air but again it makes outside noise even louder and also I had mosquito come in and were getting bitten throughout the night. 3) Elevator - It's not automatic. Someone has to bring up the car from the main floor. After ringing the bell, you could wait 4-5 min and nothing would happen. I walked down with my luggage after waiting 5 min. 4) Taxi - A bellhop offer to call a taxi resulted in someone showing up with an individual car. Not a taxi. Can be very dangerous in Mexico. 5) Rate - was charged much higher rate than was quoted in the reservation. When I asked why, they said it was 'taxes'. 6) Roof top restaurant - The food was so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel but needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Jeanpr
Reviews.Content: Upside - This is a beautiful old hotel with a great location. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Hotel and rooms are very clean. Even if you do not stay here, eat at the resturant at the top of the hotel. Downside - Sleeping on the floor is more comfotable than the bed. It was incredibly hard. There was no box spring - mattress was on top of a wooden box. The bathroom was very old - sink and shower did not work well. There was no place to put toiletries. The shower was a drizzle and there was almost no hot water. The walls are very thin and we could hear our neighbors clearly. This place could be wonderful with some TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Historical hotel that needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Sailor-NHYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean but needs better maintenance. The tub in our bathroom had a crack in it. Staff at desk were good and helpful. Requested rooms were not obtained. We asked for a double bed but got 2 twins. The room that had a double bed were dark and musty. I would advise not getting rooms on square due to noise. Restaurant food was mediocre, lukewarm and greasy. Would not recommend food. I would recommend this hotel only with the above noted reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill for years; terrible shame”
Reviews.Author: Texicano
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a lot in years past, and still prefer the antique character of the place but the old lady is in dire need of some basic restorations. There is no more central location than that of the Majestic, but decrepit rooms, scathing housekeeping, worn out furnishings and thousands of mosquitos in the room made this stay our last. In a city with many five star properties charging less, one wonders why tour companies book their clients into this hotel (nobody in the know would pay their rates for these ramshakle accomodations). Even the lovely view from the restaurant can't make up for the overpriced poor quality food and service. Our advice is stop in for drinks in the upstairs bar but stay a block north at the Holiday Inn Zocalo for clean comfortable rooms, Enjoy their rooftop restaurant for almost the same view as from the Majestic, breakfast there is convenient with a good selection, There is a descent variety of quite good restaurants within walking distance. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “staying at theMajestic was the highlight of our trip”
Reviews.Author: shandy_7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 week trip to Mexico, spending a week in Oaxaca, one in Hualtulco, and the last week in Mexico City, I did lots of research on the internet before deciding on any of the hotels. I am so glad I asked for the Majestic on the Zocalo. Our room was on the 6th floor and overlooked the Zocalo, my reaction to the view was to burst into tears with joy. We were able to see the flag ceremonies daily, plus all the on going activity, We would not have wanted to be anywhere else. I knew it would be a little noisy, but it was well worth it. The rooms are clean and have "history". The staff are great people who go out of their way to please you. The restaurant food was excellent, especially when ordering from the menu, and of course the view from the restaurant is outstanding (same view as from our room). The hotel is in the best location for tourists, we cannot praise this hotel enough. Thanks to the staff of the Majestic for making our trip so enjoyable. Hazel & David Friesen, Vernon BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “A favorite”
Reviews.Author: sjssf
Reviews.Content: It's loud and a little bit funky but it's majestic! The views onto the zocolo will stay with me forever, especially at dusk. The din is incredible but I got used to it.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a Stay”
Reviews.Author: OtterWynn
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beat. It also contributes to the noise, bring earplugs and/or ask for an interior room. The rooms are dated and could use some work, but overall comfortable and convenient. The historic character of the hotel gives it some charm. View from restaurant is incredible, especially when there is activity in the zocalo, which is all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't overlook this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marrakechlover
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I spent 6 nights here, and would absolutely stay here again.The noise from the Zocalo is everything that people say it is, to say nothing of the church bells and midddle-of-the-night nearby building alarms, but all in all, the experience was superb. If you stay in room 604 you will find a very firm kingsize bed, with a gorgeous arched window looking out over the main church on the square: it is a view that will stay with us forever. The coffee that they serve at breakfast is often lukewarm, at best, but we found a very simple solution: simply tell your waiter that you want cafe "muy caliente" - in which case they will generally bring you piping hot coffee. The breakfast buffet is superb, and the steaks for dinner are also excellent quality (even if very thing by American steak house standards). The margaritas were varied, but we found a solution to this problem as well: we snuck our own tequila into them, and added lime which they served at the table anyway. The 7th floor terrace restaurant is the place to be for both breakfast as well as dinner. This hotel really oozes with charm. The stairways, the atrium, the lobby, and the views out the window and over the balcony of the terrace restaurant really cannot be beat. If you stay anywhere else, you're making a mistake, because you will miss the "feel" of being in the middle of it all and in a building which is filled with charm. The location in the midst of the "thousand palaces" is also a must, in order to get the feel of the oppulence that once was Mexico City. One important caution though: DO NOT take advantage of the guided tours to the pyramids that can be arranged next to the front desk of the hotel. Either take a taxi or shop around. The pyramids are fantastic and must be seen, but the tour from the hotel is an absolute rip-off: they basically drove us around for half the day and made us wait in junky tourist shops, and then gave us only 60 minutes within which to tour the pyramids, which could easily be a 3 hour visit to enjoy it fully.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic mediocre”
Reviews.Author: travelingirl008
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom and niece for three nights and pretty much agree with the previous reviewers. The hotel is clean and safe, but very noisy if your room faces the Zocalo. I agree withthe previous reviewer that said the food on the terrace is expensive and mediocre, and our coffee was also cold! There are lots of nice little restaurants down the side streets with much better food that are a lot cheaper! Take time to explore the side streets, not only for eating options, but to find good bookstores, (Gandhi) and apparel shops. The best thing the Majestic has going for it is the location.

Reviews.Title: “great location...thats it.”
Reviews.Author: hihrd1
Reviews.Content: great location.... ask for a room facing the zocalo to get the whole mexico city experience. but, sadly thats the only standout at this hotel...the great view from your room. it is an old hotel and a lot of things dont work well... i had a problem with the outlets, the drain in the tub and the place wasnt very clean...i also woke up on my last nite with bedbugs bites!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and elegant, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: LindaAt
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Majestic. The first time we had a room overlooking the Zocolo, which was amazing. We loved having a view of all the activity, including the Mexican flag raising and lowering each day. We had read a review that advised that we bring ear plugs, which we did, and it made our stay much more positive!! On our second visit, most recently, we had a room overlooking a nearby street, and we were disappointed. While it was quieter, we missed the activity of the Zocolo. The room was adequate, not top-notch. The restaurant was adequte, but we won't eat there again. You can get more for the money several blocks away. We did appreciate the staff and their professionalism and respect for their guests. Everything in our room worked, and while another reviewer noted that the elevator was not working on his/her stay, this time it was working fine (although we generally chose to walk up the steps to get some great exercise!). We will likely stay there again, but will make a request for a room facing the zocolo!

Reviews.Title: “Kind of elegant lobby, but it stops there...”
Reviews.Author: CopperDogMom
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is wonderful, the lobby has that 30's Mexican elegance, but that's about all I can say in favor of the Majestic. Room was bland, bed rock hard (arm falling asleep hard...), tiled shelf in shower/bath was filthy (too tall for the short statured cleaning staff to see?), phone didn't work, etc. Husband had stayed here 30+ years ago, when the Zocalo was busy but there were not annoying faux-Axtec dancers beating on drums until 11PM onward. Food unremarkable and expensive ($13 for buffet breakfast offering nothing remarkable, and cold coffee?) Next time, we're definitely staying elsewhere. Left them all this info on the survey form... hopefully someone will pay attention to the honest feedback. We so wanted this to be a good place.. it could be if they hand out ear plugs and coupons to dine elsewhere. Nancy C

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Woolbear
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite on the second floor. Had a balcony that overlooked the Zocalo. Room was a little dated but that was easily overlooked as the location of the hotel couldn't have been more central to all the numerous sights close by. The roof terrace restaurant was an incredible place to have breakfast in the morning or a nightcap. What a view of the Zocalo! The many reviews given complaining about the noise were somewhat true, but the city has 22 million people, so if you are expecting peace and quiet, maybe Mexico City is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Magestic indeed!”
Reviews.Author: jackie056
Reviews.Content: Best Western Majestic is located in the historic district and is directly across from the zocala (town square). Request a room facing the square; there are always activites going on. Best Western did a fantastic job restoring the building to it's original grandeur. The lobby and interior garden/sitting area are stunning. Our room was OK, simple and clean. The staff was welcoming and helpful. A real treat and positive beginning to our two week adventure in central Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very little else”
Reviews.Author: Brujitaann
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Majestic on the recommendation of an old Bristish gentleman I'd met last year in Mexico City who had lunched at their famous Restaurante La Terraza there sometime during World War Two. He was very nostalgic about the experience. Sadly, I can't share his enthusiasm. The hotel was built in 1937, and time has not been kind to it. The lobby and atrium areas are attractive, as are the hallways with lovely Talavera tile embellishments, but the guest rooms and bathrooms are in dire need of a major renovation. They are shabby and dreary. One of the draperies in my room was hanging precariously. Hot water might or might not be available in the antiquated bathroom. The toilet might or might not flush (although the man with the plunger arrived promptly and solved the problem). The maid might or might not have remembered to place the promised coffee maker in the room, the in-room safe was broken, the clock blinked relentlessly, and the wiring is positively scary. The word "firetrap" kept floating to the surface of my mind, impinging on what little sleep I was able to get on the "cement slab" they called a bed, and what sounded either like construction noise or the vigorous activities of poltergeists in the next room didn't add to my feeling of delicious serentiy, especially when the noise continued far into the night. The Terrace Restaurant about which my British friend had spoken so tenderly has a spectacular view of the Zocalo, but that was all there was to recommend it. The food was mediocre, the service was poor and the prices were high. Despite the indifferent service in the dining room, the people at the reception desk and the bellhops who doubled as elevator operators were very pleasant indeed. I won't complain about the general noise as other reviewers have. Mexico City is the largest city in the world, and the Zocalo is one of the biggest squares extant, (second only to Red Square in Moscow, I seem to recall) so no reasonable person would expect it to be as quiet as an undiscovered tomb. A huge number of people congregate in the area around the incredibly beautiful Cathedral and they make a lot of noise. The traffic is non-stop and noisy. The are always sirens. Mysteriously, the Cathedral bells ring, but not when one would expect them to, and at 8:30 AM they begin a very interesting series of "responsive rings", seven chimes each from what I guess is each of the bells in the two towers. The Cathedral has a great many bells, but it's a very big cathedral. The Mexican people are intensely patriotic, and there is a large gathering for the raising and lowering the gigantic flag (big enough to carpet Rhode Island) in great ceremonial style at 8:00 AM and again at 6:00 PM in the center of the Zocalo. The ceremony includes a band with plenty of drums and trumpets, soldiers, and military policemen. After the lowering of the flag in the evening, a group of Indians takes over the noise production duties and they drum the same rhythmic pattern far, far into the night. All this being said, I knew the Majestic would include plenty of ambiant "city" noise, just not construction workers or poltergeists. The hotel has an incredible view on the side facing the Zocalo, and the location is ideal for on-foot exploration of an endless number of fascinating places such as the Cathedral on the north side of the square and the National Palace directly across the square from the hotel which houses spectacular murals by Diego Rivera. About a block north of the National Palace are the ongoing excavations of an ancient Aztec temple, called Templo Mejor. The lovely museum, Palacio de Bellas Artes, is an easy walk about a mile north of the square. The area around the Cathedral presents an unforgettable shopping adventure for almost anything you can imagine. To compensate for the dreadful food at the Majestic, "fine dining" in the periphery of the Cathedral is a joyous adventure for the pushcart gourmet, and I loved every wonderful bite of everything I bought there. Another plus of eating near the Cathedral is the opportunity to observe a great number of fascinating people going about their daily lives. On my next visit to Mexico City, I intend to stay at the Hotel Catedral, which is a couple of blocks away because I love the central location, but sadly, I've enjoyed just about as much of the Majestic as I can stand.

Reviews.Title: “a dump”
Reviews.Author: frankhill58
Reviews.Content: tthis place is a dumb yes it is old and nice from the design----but the elevator is not working from the last time i was there--------I did not mind the noise due to sleeping pills I take but they charged me 5usdollars for 15 min on the computor the food on the roof was crap and the service stank. if i was not wacked out on sleeping pils I could not have slept and i was charged 125 a nite and found the same room was at 70 a nite if you got it at the booth at the airport say away from the dump frank

Reviews.Title: “Location: that's it!”
Reviews.Author: mkabell
Reviews.Content: Location, location, locationâ€¦! We were lucky to have a room on the 5th floor with a view over the ZÃ³calo, and though noisy (could someone do away with the guys pretending to be Aztecs dancing most afternoons with their drums, please!), we wouldnâ€™t have switched rooms for a second. We had first class view of the hoisting of the giant flag and all other life on the square. The rooms, though, are not up to standard. They are clean, but need a serious refurbishment. Curtains and carpets are holed, the water is seldom hot, and the bathrooms were fine, but obsolete. When we left and asked for a taxi, we were asked to drive with â€“ someoneâ€™s friend (?). In a city that emphasizes taxi security so much, that is simply not acceptable, and Best Western should definitely not accept the bell boy or reception helping their friend in this way. We will not stay there again, as the hotel generally seemed to be ignorant of security: Their safes in the rooms donâ€™t work, and reception openly says that they donâ€™t care. They offer valuables to be kept in the cellar below the receptionâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great - if you're deaf!!”
Reviews.Author: qednick
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Mexico City. We chose this hotel due to the location which was perfect for us. However, our main complaint was the noise. We feel like we haven't had any sleep for the last week because of this. It's not just the fact that you can hear other guests through the walls but, because we had a balcony room overlooking the street, be aware that there are traffic cops that take over the job of the traffic lights between about 7.30am and 8.30pm and all they do all day long is constantly blow whistles very loudly. One day, I had a migraine and I literally had to stuff toilet paper in my ears and stick my head between two pillows it was so noisey!! The beds are hard and there's no fans or temperature controls. I don't know whether the water was purified or not but there was a sign in the bathroom stating that it is. The lock from our in-room safe was missing altogether. The restaurant on the rooftop is not bad but they serve cold drinks warm and warm drinks cold (eg. warm coke, cold coffee). They don't appear to have ice. The only drinks we ordered that were actually cold were Coronas.

Reviews.Title: “Find Another Option!”
Reviews.Author: GalagirlBoston
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers, we chose this hotel for the location. But we experienced the same problems: LOTS of noise (even with our interior room--you can still hear the sounds of the guests in the courtyard, and through the paper thin walls); no fan or air-conditioning; insufficient towels; bottled water provided only on the first night (we were told it's "complimentary upon arrival", but after that you have to buy it--this is unacceptable in a country in which you need purified water to brush your teeth); seriously dingy decor; and a sleazy travel agent at the front desk. The agency set us up with an excellent taxi driver/guide (his name is Miguel), but the charge was astronomical ($1200 pesos for a half day for two people--nearly double what we were originally quoted), and we later learned that the agency pockets half of the fee and treats its employees poorly. Find another place to stay and shop around for a decent deal on tours.

Reviews.Title: “Good But Not the Only Viable Location in Mex. City”
Reviews.Author: Gardener535
Reviews.Content: The hotel building is an architectural gem, but the management is mediocre, though the non-management staff are friendly. When we arrived, there was no orientation to the hotel or surrounding area---the hotel is right on the Zocalo! Every day, they cleaned to interior courtyard floors with a strong oil-based cleaner that left a pungent smell for hours. The top floor restuarant has a great view of the Zocalo if you happen to get the right table, otherwise, the view is quite restricted. And, the food and drinks are terrible--we had the worst margarita that side of the Rio Grande river we've ever had. Finally, we reported that the maid had not left any bottled water on the 2nd day and were told that water was complementary ONLY for the 1st day and we had to go to the lobby to buy some if we wanted more---how cheap can you get! I left a note for the manager and never got a response. I recommend hotels in the Zona Rosa. Mexico City is easy to traverse by cab or minibuses on Reforma.

Reviews.Title: “Potentials but not quite perfect”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaRes
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on the recommendations of some friends who said the hotel is their favorite in Mexico City. The hotel is right on the Zocalo, which has its advantages and disadvantages. The view is great if you get a room facing the Zocalo, you feel that you have the whole city under you. The problem is that, it gets very noisy, esp. on the Sunday when we were there, there were some sort of soccer tournaments on the Zocalo, beginning at 6 a.m. in the morning. That made it a bit tough to sleep in. The breakfast was pretty rich, good for the price of 100 pesos, it was a buffet, with all kinds of meat, vegies, fruit, and juices. Dinner was uneventful, but inexpensive. The restaurant is on the roof ot he hotel, with a fantastic view of the city, beautiful at night, very romantic. The rooms have lots of potentials, tiled and high ceilings, but decorated very sparsely and with basic unattractive furniture. The lobby, stairs and hotel facade can be beautiful, if efforts and money were put into renovation. The service is good enough, very courteous and helpful English speaking staff. At 80 USD a night, I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel but well placed for the zocalo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Noisy - expect to be woken from about 5am by people talking, singing etc. Rooms not very big and the bathrooms look like they have the tiling and baths from the 1930's (with not that much maintenance). Has hot water in the bathrooms though! The rooms are clean and there are safes in each room but sometimes no keys! Breakfast is about 50 pesos for a buffet - we didn't sample it but got coffee pastries etc from a 7/11 2 minutes from the hotel. We had dinner one night at the hotel and the food was good and arrived reasonably quickly (for Mexico). The restaurant is on the top floor and looks out onto the Zocalo and gives a good view of it at night whent eh cathedral is lit up. Really in the Zocalo and 10 minutes by foot from the belle artes (where Diego Rivera murals are).

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Acapulqueno
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is located in an old building right on the Zocalo, and has both inside and outside rooms. I have stayed there many times because I like the convenient location. I always ask for a room high on the outside, but these can be very noisy, as can those rooms on the top floor, just under the good restaurant, where they seem to work 24 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “good location - ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: bcad
Reviews.Content: Our group got a good rate of $55 per weekend night. The location of the hotel was convenient to many sites such as the zocalo, the Ballet and the metro. The area seemed very safe even at night. The hotel was clean and the staff was very nice. We had two "courtyard" rooms with 3 single beds in each. The rooms were very spacious by Mexico standards and the bathrooms were huge. There was however no window in the room. The rooms were at the end of the hall, beyond the courtyard, so the opaque glass block window faced a stairway and did not open. There is no airconditioning so with no window it got a bit stuffy. The rooms were very quiet at night however. The third room in our group had a window on the zocalo. It was noisy!!!! The room was smaller with two double beds and a smaller bathroom. I would stay here again because of the location and the pleasant staff and the price was right. I would not get a zocalo room however.

Reviews.Title: “No peace and quiet!!”
Reviews.Author: mimijo63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights originally and had to make reservations before we left the US. The cost was $75.00 per night with no breakfast. They charged our credit card in total when we made the reservation. We then had to change our plans due to airline cancellation (which can be frequently in Mexico), we were unable to make reservations for one more night months in advance. The hotel is very hot, and very, very noisy!!!! No airconditioning or fans and constant protests with drums, music, and constant chaos in the square. We got virtually no sleep at all. The staff was for the most part helpful. All tours had to be paid for in cash and not visa (eventhough there was a credit card terminal clearly present in plain sight). The elevator has to be run by staff due to the age and we had many times we could not get anyone to bring elevator to our floor (the 6th floor, arrghh!!!), so we had to make the trip up or down the flights of stairs. We had to move to a hotel that was about 6 blocks away when we were unable to get the last night there and it was a relief having airconditioning, working elevators, no noise and about 1/2 the cost!!! Also note, Best Western states they are not affiliated with the Majestic any longer when I tried originally to make reservations, guess I know why! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone unless you enjoy noise! All shops, restarants in the area close early, so not much to do in the evening. The traffic was also tremendous getting into the center of town due to the multiple demonstrations, protests, etc. It took a lot of time just to reach the hotel by taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic hotel, but noisy surroundings”
Reviews.Author: MigsOfWigs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Majestic for 4 nights in January 2005. The service was great and food in the restaurant very good. Views from the exterior rooms are spectacular, of the magnificent Cathedral and the Zocalo with the biggest flag in the world. Also the room was only $65 which was an excellent price for the location. However on the downside this was the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed in. As other reviewers of this hotel have pointed out, there is the flag raising ceremony at 0530 with soldiers drumming and barking orders. Then from 0600 demonstrations against the Mayor in the nearby palace commence, with guys ranting into rock concert strength microphones. Next the cathedral starts chiming from around 0830. Throughout the night traffic noise is another disturbance. I moved rooms 3 times, lastly to an interior room (don't book an interior room on the 6th floor as the restaurant cleaning staff above tap about in high heels at 0300!) on the 2nd floor. Slept OK but no view. Only my aunt refused to change rooms as she is an insomniac and didn't sleep anyway! Michael, England.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the room did look out into the center part of the hotel; had a great view of the bar. But, this type of "closed-in" feeling is par-for-the-course in Mexico. They thrive on being boxed in. The people were GREAT, helpful, courteous. The location is perfect - right across from the Zocalo. From the top, at the hotel restaurant, is a great view of the cathedral, Mexico City lights, and the Zocolo (lots going on down there to watch from protests, to VW Bug rallys, to Aztec dance lessons - a true gathering place for the people). We paid only $65 per night (US$ in July 2004) and stayed one night - BUT we had to book it online before we left the States. Considering what other hotels on the Zocolo were charging, it was a great deal. I felt safe and even walked around with my son (I'm a woman). There were police officers on many street corners after 9:00 p.m. Only drawback was that the general area closed down at 10:00 so if you're looking for nightlife you won't find it here.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but will not stay here again - Noisy”
Reviews.Author: norwaybeachboy
Reviews.Content: Spent two days here from 31 jan to 1 february 2005. Booked the room from the hotelservice at the airport. Got a room facing the inside at the 6 floor, but it was still very noisy. The room had a door connection to the room next door, so it felt like the other guests were in my room. Some times during the night there were drilling noise(i think). In the evening there was a lot of noise from the restaurant/bar upstairs. The location is great, and the people working there were friendly. The tourbus stop is only 150 m from the hotel. Took a private cab from outside the hotel to the airport(recommended by the staff), it cost 130 pesos. The breakfast was included and was ok. Didn't feel safe in the area at night - but i'm a sceptic :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: sftrav
Reviews.Content: We had a three room suite right on the Zocalo, which initially looked quite nice, but it turned out to be the noisiest place we had ever stayed! There were people talking on bullhorns in the square until late every night and lots of traffic noises and alarms going off all night, including a car crash one night. There is a flag raising ceremony every morning at 5:45 a.m. (involving drums and bugles) which woke us up every time. Also, the lighting in our suite was very dim for reading at night. It was not a good place despite the fact that the lobby was very beautiful and the staff was nice and helpful. A bellman named Constantino spoke very good English and fixed us up with taxis, including a driver to go to the Pyramids, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Majestic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Majestic was one the most enjoyable hotel stays that I have ever had. My wife and I stayed at the Majestic during our honeymoon (Oct. 31-Nov. 4 2004). The Zocolo view was wonderful and with Dia de los Muertos going on the area was alive with people. The staff was extremely courteous and efficient. I will recommend this hotel to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Way over priced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with what the hotel had to offer for the price you had to pay. First of all I spent $100 plus a night on a one person room, the rooms really need to be renovated. YOu would think they could afford better for the killing they are probably making with what they charge. I assume alot of what one pays there is for the location, extrememly close to the Zocalo, but I stayed at a hotel for $30 a night closer to business district , later on during my trip and felt I got a better deal with the 30 bucks. I really don't recommend this hotel unless, money is not a problem, you want to be really close to the Zocalo, etc. As for the person who said don't take the green and white taxis, they are find but make sure they have a meter in them, and it defienetly helps to know some Spanish or be someone that knows it, or almost anyone can take advantage of you down there. The Hotels taxi was the run that ripped me off bad, I would think they would be the honest ones, but anyways suit yourself.

Reviews.Title: “No No "amarse""”
Reviews.Author: peddler665
Reviews.Content: On checking in we were shown to an inside room with twin beds. I smiled while encircling my wife's waist sayin NO! No! Amarse! The bell hop smiled, called the desk & we were soon in a room at the top of the hotel with a fantastic view of the Zocalo. Rooms a bit plain, but very clean. Had all the extras I need, hair dryer, wall safe, host bar at prices even I could afford ect. The one draw back was that we were right under the dance floor of the night club, but it closes very early so was not a real problem. We spent New Years eve first on the roof, than in our room watching the incredible action on the Zocalo. Our room had a balcony, but was very small with a low low railing. It was a straight drop of a 100' plus so we kept the doors open, bu did not venture on it. I see that another reviewer belayed the lack of dining in the area. We did not find this true. Our number one find was Cicero Centenario, a 5 star eatery in a old colonial mansion just a few blocks away. Several different groups of musicians strolled through the various dining rooms. The food & service could not be better. Our bill for a 5 course dinner (my wife had 3 glasses of vino) with tip was $38.00 US. Best value I have ever found in Mecico. We walked back to the Majestic, but best to call a cab. Anyways a good hotel with a great location & a Great Dining find at Cireros!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend on the Zocalo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is at the heart of the city -- it sits right on the Zocalo, the 2nd largest (after Req Square) public square in the world. As you look out at the Zocalo, you're at the edge of Mexico's history -- the Templo Mayor of the Aztecs, the Spanish colonial cathedral, the swearing in of presidents, a few limited revolutions, and everything else that matters in Mexico. Second, it's well staffed, well run, efficient, and relatively friendly (for a big city hotel, in particular). It provides personalized attention if you need it, and the staff leaves you alone if that's what you want. The rooms are good value (not surprisingly, negotiable rates, especially during this New Depression). We were most recently there in June 2003. A suggestion: go for the weekend, when downtown is less crowded, and the air is markedly better (fewer cars downtown). Be sensible (don't wander around outside drunkenly, and don't take the green VW taxis) and enjoy being at the heart of a great City.

Reviews.Title: “Wished it were better...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby and hallways of this hotel are truly gorgeous, which makes the very plain guest rooms something of a letdown. The staff are friendly and helpful. Rather than asking whether we would prefer a Zocalo or Courtyard view the desk clerk simplified the choice as Noisy or Quiet. I definitely recommend the rooftop restaurant, not for its competent food but for the amazing view of the zocalo and the cathedral. If it all becomes too much this is a great place to retreat to. Come admire the lobby, enjoy the view from the restaurant, but stay somewhere else where you can get a better value for your money. My review is admittedly colored by the following: It was quite warm during our visit, prompting us to leave our window open all night. I was awakened by a buzzing insect during the night and in the morning found both myself and my husband covered from literally head to toe in red bites that eventually became very itchy. We looked like we had smallpox. After changing hotels we had no more insect problems.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Majestic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cat lips
Reviews.Content: In August of 2002, my wife and I stayed at the Best Western Majestic Hotel. Overall, we were impressed with the building's appearance and the staff. The hotel is very well maintained and the lobby and restuarant were in fine shape. The staff could not have been more helpful or pleasant. However, the room did show its age somewhat. The room was clean and certainly did not want for anything, but the bathroom and the furniture probably date back to the beginnings of the hotel. We dined at the hotel's restuarant for both dinner and breakfast, and both meals were outstanding. I would reccommend eating there because the food is good, and the view of the Historic Center is unbeatable. The hotel's location is very convenient for exploring the this part of the city. During the day, there are a lot of places to see. However, at night, there are few places to eat or visit in the Historic Center, and I would recommend either staying in the hotel or taking a hotel taxi somewhere else.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Majestic
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida Madero 73 | Col Centro, Mexico City 06000, Mexico
